availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Sympson (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Jane Irwin Sympson in Clark County, Kentucky, on February 22, 1825. Father of James Sympson, Frances E. Sympson, William C. Sympson, and Allan H. Sympson. Farmer in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved people in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved people in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 40A.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Precinct 6, p. 93A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film #001943687, p. 216.
